alert.note: Alert for Autauga; Dallas; Lowndes; Montgomery (Alabama) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued June 20 at 8:52PM CDT by NWS Birmingham
info.description: ...Strong thunderstorms will impact portions of southern Autauga, northern Lowndes, east central Dallas and northwestern Montgomery Counties through 930 PM CDT... At 852 PM CDT, Doppler radar was tracking strong thunderstorms along a line extending from near Gardner Island to near Hunter. Movement was southeast at 10 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph and pea size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Southwestern Montgomery, Prattville, Selma, Autaugaville, White Hall, Lowndesboro, Benton, Hunter, Gardner Island, Hope Hull, Tyler, Autauga County Airport, Woodcrest, Dannelly Field, Manack and Robert F. Henry Lock And Dam. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.25 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: Torrential rainfall is also occurring with these storms and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways. Frequent cloud to ground lightning is occurring with these storms. Lightning can strike 10 miles away from a thunderstorm. Seek a safe shelter inside a building or vehicle.
